Sentencas: Oxygen-electrode-supported solid oxide cells (OESCs) have potential advantages over fuel-electrode-supported cells, including reduced fuel-electrode concentration polarization, better oxygen electrode current collection, and flexibility in the fuel electrode choice.
Titulo: Characteristics of Oxygen Electrode Supported Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: However, there are serious drawbacks including the difficulty of co-firing the oxygen electrode and electrolyte, and oxygen electrode concentration polarization.
Titulo: Characteristics of Oxygen Electrode Supported Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: This paper explores the characteristics of OESCs with La0.8Sr0.2MnO3-delta -Zr0.92Y0.16O2-delta (LSM-YSZ) electrode-support enhanced by SrTi0.3Fe0.6Co0.1O3-delta (STFC) infiltration, thin YSZ electrolyte, and SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-delta (STF) fuel electrodes.
Titulo: Characteristics of Oxygen Electrode Supported Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: The STFC infiltration increases fuel cell maximum power density by >1.5 times and electrolysis current density (at 1.3 V) by >2 times.
Titulo: Characteristics of Oxygen Electrode Supported Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: Cell performance in pure oxygen is compared to that in air, exploring a possible reversible solid oxide cell system configuration where oxygen produced during electrolysis is stored and subsequently used during fuel cell operation.
Titulo: Characteristics of Oxygen Electrode Supported Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: The fuel cell maximum power density is increased from 0.88 W cm(-2) in air to 1.37 W cm(-2) in oxygen, with limiting current increased from 1.7 to >5.6 A cm(-2); the electrolysis performance is essentially unchanged, probably because the electrode air becomes enriched with oxygen during electrolysis.
Titulo: Characteristics of Oxygen Electrode Supported Reversible Solid Oxide Cells
